channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: What is Skylight? Here’s what you need to know about the TikTok alternative
item.description: The current king of social media is the short-form video platform TikTok. It’s where trends are forged, news is broken, and opinions spread.
item.dc:creator: Michael Grothaus, Fast Company

item.title: The NBA is extending its relationship with one of the sporting world’s most intriguing start-up companies
item.description: The NBA and Cosm, the entertainment company that’s reinventing the sports bar with what they like to call “shared reality,” announced Thursday an extended partnership to air live NBA games in Cosm’s domes.
item.dc:creator: CNN.com Wire Service, The Mercury News

item.title: Bill Gates is just plain wrong about climate change
item.description: Bill Gates has invested billions over the last two decades to help fight climate change. But in a new blog post, he argues that world is too focused on cutting short-term emissions.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: More than a million people talk to ChatGPT about suicide each week
item.description: Welcome to AI Decoded, Fast Company’s weekly newsletter that breaks down the most important news in the world of AI. I’m Mark Sullivan, a senior writer at Fast Company, covering emerging tech, AI, and tech policy.
item.dc:creator: Mark Sullivan, Fast Company

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Strengthening security with a converged security and networking platform
item.description: Today’s IT environment of multiple clouds, hybrid work, and the exploding popularity of AI has given cybercriminals unprecedented opportunities for launching attacks — and the traditional arsenal of tools organizations use to stop them isn’t working.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: What’s the most malicious TLD? Cloudflare reveals surprising risks, usage patterns
item.description: The domain name system has evolved significantly since its inception. What started out as just a handful of generic top-level domains with .com, .net and .org has expanded to more than 1,400 valid TLDs as of October 2025. Another expansion round is scheduled to begin in April 2026.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Unit testing Spring MVC applications with JUnit 5
item.description: Spring is a reliable and popular framework for building web and enterprise Java applications. In this article, you’ll learn how to unit test each layer of a Spring MVC application, using built-in testing tools from JUnit 5 and Spring to mock each component’s dependencies.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Oracle’s cloud strategy an increasingly risky bet
item.description: The financing arrangement for Oracle’s massive data center plan aimed at feeding the AI monster could result in a $38 billion debt offering as soon as next week, and according to this week’s report from Morgan Stanley, that figure could skyrocket to $55 billion – $75 billion as a result of the “shee
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Jerome Powell: AI boom is not a bubble, could 'absolutely' affect job market
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday he did not believe the massive growth in artificial intelligence (AI) investment and spending was a bubble.
item.dc:creator: Sylvan Lane, The Hill

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Arista fills out AI networking portfolio
item.description: Arista Networks has added more models, greater speed, and new line cards to its portfolio of high-performance networking gear targeting large-scale AI and cloud data center customers.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Character.AI to ban children from talking with chatbots
item.description: Character.AI plans to ban children from talking with its AI chatbots starting next month amid growing scrutiny over how young users are interacting with the technology.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Cisco, Nvidia strengthen AI ties with new data center switch, reference architectures
item.description: Cisco and Nvidia are ramping up their partnership, and the latest deliverables include the new Cisco N9100 series data center switch built on Nvidia’s Spectrum-X Ethernet switch silicon.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: AI truck system matches top human drivers in massive safety showdown with perfect scores
item.description: Kodiak Driver autonomous truck achieves perfect 98 safety score, matching top human fleets in groundbreaking AI evaluation by Nauto's VERA system.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: GitHub launches Agent HQ to bring order to AI-powered coding
item.description: GitHub is taking a major step toward redefining enterprise software development with the launch of Agent HQ, a platform that lets developers manage and orchestrate multiple AI coding agents from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and others directly within the GitHub environment.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: TypeScript rises to the top on GitHub
item.description: TypeScript, Microsoft’s strongly typed JavaScript variant, has become the most-used language on GitHub, according to GitHub’s Octoverse 2025 report released on October 28.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death
item.description: "We're hacking the complexity of the defense acquisition system so America's technologists can focus on solving technology problems," said Keoki Jackson. The post A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network

item.title: How a tiny retinal implant is helping people regain their sight
item.description: Revolutionary retinal implant restores central vision in 80% of patients with advanced macular degeneration, offering hope where treatments once only slowed blindness.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Elon Musk launches AI Grokipedia to compete with Wikipedia
item.description: The site comes after conservatives have criticized Wikipedia for exclouding some conservative outlets from its list of reputable sources.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: How to use passkeys to keep your computer safe
item.description: Learn how to use passkeys on Windows and Mac computers without cameras or fingerprint readers. Discover secure authentication methods that replace passwords.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: New military age demands new C2 comms
item.description: As purposely scattered forces replace massing, all units need access to rich and latency-free crucial situational data regardless of from where they operate. The post New military age demands new C2 comms first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Tom Temin, Federal News Network

item.title: Anthropic draws fire from White House with AI warnings
item.description: Anthropic has been a rare voice within the artificial intelligence (AI) industry cautioning about the downsides of the technology it develops and supporting regulation — a stance that has recently drawn the ire of the Trump administration and its allies in Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Meta AI edits your camera roll for better Facebook posts
item.description: Facebook's new Meta AI feature analyzes your camera roll photos to create polished collages automatically, but requires cloud processing and raises privacy concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
